question: the alterations of the rural town between 1983 and present.
text: The given maps illustrate the alterations of the rural metropolis between 1983 and the present. The general overview here is that the town undergoes a considerable transformation after the construction takes place.

According to the first map, it can be seen that in 1983 the city consisted of one main road running from the west to the east with connected to Munster avenue to the southwest, there was a farm situated on the east side of this road  and a windmill located on the opposite side, while the main avenue, to the west there were five houses on both side of the street, Next to these, situated to the north was a school, whereas there were a police station and post  office located to the south near the river bank which was called river may running from the north to the south.Moreover, the shop was located to the east and there was a huge forest situated on the northeast side of the city.

At present, the old houses remain unaffected, but the green area to the northwest is all gone to make room for a new high road, with surround by a new house and connected to the main street. a dame is constructed on the north side of the river. The shop is replaced by an enormous supermarket. Similarly, where the farm stood there is a petrol station and a cafe’ nearby. However, the main facilities of the town remain unchanged.
